meanings.definition: A representation of the phallus as an object of reverence in ancient Greece.
meanings.sent1: In ancient Greece, the priapi were symbols of respect and worship.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed various priapi sculptures from the ancient era.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about a giant priapi statue causing chaos in the city square.
meanings.sent4: His pride was like a priapi, standing tall and commanding attention.
meanings.sent5: The intricate details of the priapi carvings left a lasting impression on the visitors.

meanings.definition: A male deity of procreation and fertility in ancient Greek mythology.
meanings.sent1: People in ancient Greece believed in the priapi as powerful fertility gods.
meanings.sent2: The temple was dedicated to the priapi, where offerings were made for abundant harvests.
meanings.sent3: The priapi were said to bless the fields with bountiful crops each year.
meanings.sent4: His strength and virility were compared to that of the priapi in legends.
meanings.sent5: The villagers celebrated the harvest festival with songs praising the priapi for their blessings.
